Major changes in error handling and listening:
Reworked implementation. I was unhappy with the complexity of the previous one. Now  there's a simpler master implementation
New recipe for shared counts
Major changes to semaphore code. At the same time  re-wrote LockInternals to be simpler. The previous sempahores had lots of problems and restrictions.
Major change. Previously  exceptions that couldn't be handled would cause the client to close and a handler to be called. Now  the client is _not_
Hat-tip to https://github.com/sbridges for pointing this out
Added a way to control re-queuing behavior when a consumer throws an exception.
Punted on the previous coop implementation. I've decided to maintain two distinct types of semaphores. The existing version
Modified CoopInterProcessSemaphore so that the number of leases values can be changed after instance creation

Improved way of monitoring changes. Instead of issuing a ZooKeeper call for every change  just post an event to a queue so that the ZK can be queries. This way  in a distruptive moment  only 1 ZK call is made instead of many

Shaded Guava into Curator Client (and Curator Test) so that it's no longer an issue for users. This should have been done a long time ago. Unfortunately  com.google.common.base.Function  com.google.common.base.Predicate and com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken are in Curator's public API so those 3 classes are NOT shaded. However  this won't be a problem because there's no reason to think that Guava will change or remove these basic interfaces
